azurerm-datasource-builtin-role-definiti.body:
data "azurerm_builtin_role_definition" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the built-in Role Definition. Possible values are: `Contributor`, `Owner`, `Reader` and `VirtualMachineContributor`.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - the ID of the built-in Role Definition.
    # "description" - the Description of the built-in Role.
    # "type" - the Type of the Role.
    # "permissions" - a "permissions" block as documented below.
    # "assignable_scopes" - One or more assignable scopes for this Role Definition, such as "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333", "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup", or "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/myVM".
    # "actions" - a list of actions supported by this role
    # "not_actions" - a list of actions which are denied by this role
}
azurerm-datasource-builtin-role-definiti.description: Use this data source to access the properties of a built-in Role Definition. To access information about a custom Role Definition, [please see the `azurerm_role_definition` data source](role_definition.html) instead.

azurerm-datasource-client-config.body:
data "azurerm_client_config" "$1" {
    # Exported Attributes
    # "client_id" is set to the Azure Client ID (Application Object ID).
    # "tenant_id" is set to the Azure Tenant ID.
    # "subscription_id" is set to the Azure Subscription ID.
    # "service_principal_application_id" is the Service Principal Application ID.
    # "service_principal_object_id" is the Service Principal Object ID.
}
azurerm-datasource-client-config.description:
Use this data source to access the configuration of the Azure Resource Manager
provider.

azurerm-datasource-image.body:
data "azurerm_image" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) The Name of the Resource Group where this Image exists.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Image.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "location" - the Azure Location where this Image exists.
    # "os_disk" - a "os_disk" block as defined below.
    # "data_disk" - a collection of "data_disk" blocks as defined below.
    # "tags" - a mapping of tags to assigned to the resource.
    # "os_disk" supports the following:
    # "blob_uri" - the URI in Azure storage of the blob used to create the image.
    # "caching" - the caching mode for the OS Disk, such as "ReadWrite", "ReadOnly", or "None".
    # "managed_disk_id" - the ID of the Managed Disk used as the OS Disk Image.
    # "os_state" - the State of the OS used in the Image, such as "Generalized".
    # "os_type" - the type of Operating System used on the OS Disk. such as "Linux" or "Windows".
    # "size_gb" - the size of the OS Disk in GB.
    # "data_disk" supports the following:
    # "blob_uri" - the URI in Azure storage of the blob used to create the image.
    # "caching" - the caching mode for the Data Disk, such as "ReadWrite", "ReadOnly", or "None".
    # "lun" - the logical unit number of the data disk.
    # "managed_disk_id" - the ID of the Managed Disk used as the Data Disk Image.
    # "size_gb" - the size of this Data Disk in GB.
}
azurerm-datasource-image.description: Use this data source to access information about an Image.

azurerm-datasource-key-vault-access-poli.body:
data "azurerm_key_vault_access_policy" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Management Tempalte. Possible values are: `Key Management`,
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - the ID of the Key Vault Access Policy
    # "key_permissions" - the key permissions for the access policy
    # "secret_permissions" - the secret permissions for the access policy
    # "certificate_permissions" - the certificate permissions for the access policy
}
azurerm-datasource-key-vault-access-poli.description: Use this data source to access information about the permissions from the Management Key Vault Templates.

azurerm-datasource-managed-disk.body:
data "azurerm_managed_disk" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the resource group.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Managed Disk.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "storage_account_type" - The storage account type for the managed disk.
    # "source_uri" - The source URI for the managed disk
    # "source_resource_id" - ID of an existing managed disk that the current resource was created from.
    # "os_type" - The operating system for managed disk. Valid values are "Linux" or "Windows"
    # "disk_size_gb" - The size of the managed disk in gigabytes.
    # "tags" - A mapping of tags assigned to the resource.
}
azurerm-datasource-managed-disk.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an existing Azure Managed Disk.

azurerm-datasource-platform-image.body:
data "azurerm_platform_image" "$1" {
    # sku - (Required) Specifies the SKU of the Platform Image.
    sku = ""

    # offer - (Required) Specifies the Offer associated with the Platform Image.
    offer = ""

    # publisher - (Required) Specifies the Publisher associated with the Platform Image.
    publisher = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the Location to pull information about this Platform Image from.
    location = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Platform Image.
    # "version" - The latest version of the Platform Image.
}
azurerm-datasource-platform-image.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an Azure Platform Image.

azurerm-datasource-public-ip.body:
data "azurerm_public_ip" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the resource group.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the public IP address.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "domain_name_label" - The label for the Domain Name.
    # "idle_timeout_in_minutes" - Specifies the timeout for the TCP idle connection.
    # "fqdn" - Fully qualified domain name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.
    # "ip_address" - The IP address value that was allocated.
    # "tags" - A mapping of tags to assigned to the resource.
}
azurerm-datasource-public-ip.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an existing Azure Public IP Address.

azurerm-datasource-resource-group.body:
data "azurerm_resource_group" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the resource group.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "location" - The location of the resource group.
    # "tags" - A mapping of tags assigned to the resource group.
}
azurerm-datasource-resource-group.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an Azure resource group.

azurerm-datasource-role-definition.body:
data "azurerm_role_definition" "$1" {
    # scope - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    scope = ""

    # role_definition_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the Role Definition as a UUID/GUID.
    role_definition_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - the ID of the built-in Role Definition.
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "description" - the Description of the built-in Role.
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "type" - the Type of the Role.
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "permissions" - a "permissions" block as documented below.
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "assignable_scopes" - One or more assignable scopes for this Role Definition, such as "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333", "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup", or "/subscriptions/0b1f6471-1bf0-4dda-aec3-111122223333/resourceGroups/myGroup/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/myVM".
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "actions" - a list of actions supported by this role
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
    # "not_actions" - a list of actions which are denied by this role
    # "scope" - (Required) Specifies the Scope at which the Custom Role Definition exists.
}
azurerm-datasource-role-definition.description: Use this data source to access the properties of a custom Role Definition. To access information about a built-in Role Definition, [please see the `azurerm_builtin_role_definition` data source](builtin_role_definition.html) instead.

azurerm-datasource-snapshot.body:
data "azurerm_snapshot" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the resource group the Snapshot is located in.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Snapshot.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Snapshot.
    # "create_option" - How the snapshot was created.
    # "source_uri" - The URI to a Managed or Unmanaged Disk.
    # "source_resource_id" - The reference to an existing snapshot.
    # "storage_account_id" - The ID of an storage account.
    # "disk_size_gb" - The size of the Snapshotted Disk in GB.
}
azurerm-datasource-snapshot.description: Use this data source to access the properties of a Snapshot of an Disk.

azurerm-datasource-subnet.body:
data "azurerm_subnet" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the resource group the Virtual Network is located in.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # virtual_network_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Virtual Network this Subnet is located within.
    virtual_network_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Subnet.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the Subnet.
    # "address_prefix" - The address prefix used for the subnet.
    # "network_security_group_id" - The ID of the Network Security Group associated with the subnet.
    # "route_table_id" - The ID of the Route Table associated with this subnet.
    # "ip_configurations" - The collection of IP Configurations with IPs within this subnet.
}
azurerm-datasource-subnet.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an Azure Subnet located within a Virtual Network.

azurerm-datasource-subscription.body:
data "azurerm_subscription" "$1" {
    # subscription_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the subscription. If this argument is omitted, the subscription ID of the current Azure Resource Manager provider is used.
    subscription_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "display_name" - The subscription display name.
    # "state" - The subscription state. Possible values are Enabled, Warned, PastDue, Disabled, and Deleted.
    # "location_placement_id" - The subscription location placement ID.
    # "quota_id" - The subscription quota ID.
    # "spending_limit" - The subscription spending limit.
}
azurerm-datasource-subscription.description: Use this data source to access the properties of an Azure subscription.

azurerm-resource-app-service-plan.body:
resource "azurerm_app_service_plan" "$1" {
    # size - (Required) Specifies the plan's instance size.
    size = ""

    # tier - (Required) Specifies the plan's pricing tier.
    tier = ""

    # sku - (Required) A `sku` block as documented below.
    sku = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the App Service Plan component.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the App Service Plan component. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # kind - (Optional) The kind of the App Service Plan to create. Possible values are `Windows` and `Linux`. Defaults to `Windows`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    kind = ""

    # properties - (Optional) A `properties` block as documented below.
    properties = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # sku - (Optional) `sku` supports the following:
    sku = ""

    # capacity - (Optional) Specifies the number of workers associated with this App Service Plan.
    capacity = ""

    # properties - (Optional) `properties` supports the following:
    properties = ""

    # maximum_number_of_workers - (Optional) Maximum number of instances that can be assigned to this App Service plan.
    maximum_number_of_workers = ""

    # reserved - (Optional) Is this App Service Plan `Reserved`. Defaults to `false`.
    reserved = ""

    # per_site_scaling - (Optional) Can Apps assigned to this App Service Plan be scaled independently? If set to `false` apps assigned to this plan will scale to all instances of the plan.  Defaults to `false`.
    per_site_scaling = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the App Service Plan component.
    # "per_site_scaling" - (Optional) Can Apps assigned to this App Service Plan be scaled independently? If set to "false" apps assigned to this plan will scale to all instances of the plan.  Defaults to "false".
    # "maximum_number_of_workers" - The maximum number of workers supported with the App Service Plan's sku.
    # "per_site_scaling" - (Optional) Can Apps assigned to this App Service Plan be scaled independently? If set to "false" apps assigned to this plan will scale to all instances of the plan.  Defaults to "false".
}
azurerm-resource-app-service-plan.description: Create an App Service Plan component.

    http_listener = ""

    # backend_http_settings - (Required) Related group of backend http and/or https features to be applied when routing to backend address pools.  The `backend_http_settings` block supports fields documented below.
    backend_http_settings = ""

    # backend_address_pool - (Required) Backend pools can be composed of NICs, virtual machine scale sets, public IPs, internal IPs, fully qualified domain names (FQDN), and multi-tenant back-ends like Azure Web Apps. Application Gateway backend pool members are not tied to an availability set. Members of backend pools can be across clusters, data centers, or outside of Azure as long as they have IP connectivity.  The `backend_address_pool` block supports fields documented below.
    backend_address_pool = ""

    # frontend_ip_configuration - (Required) Specifies lists of frontend IP configurations. Currently only one Public and/or one Private IP address can be specified. Also one frontendIpConfiguration element can specify either Public or Private IP address, not both.  The `frontend_ip_configuration` block supports fields documented below.
    frontend_ip_configuration = ""

    # frontend_port - (Required) Front-end port for the application gateway.  The `frontend_port` block supports fields documented below.
    frontend_port = ""

    # gateway_ip_configuration - (Required) List of subnets that the application gateway is deployed into.  The application gateway must be deployed into an existing virtual network/subnet.  No other resource can be deployed in a subnet where application gateway is deployed.  The `gateway_ip_configuration` block supports fields documented below.
    gateway_ip_configuration = ""

    # sku - (Required) Specifies size, tier and capacity of the application gateway.  Must be specified once.  The `sku` block fields documented below.
    sku = ""

    # location - (Required) The location/region where the application gateway is   created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the application gateway.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the application gateway. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # probe - (Optional) Specifies list of URL probes. The `probe` block supports fields documented below.
    probe = ""

    # url_path_map - (Optional) UrlPathMaps give url Path to backend mapping information for PathBasedRouting specified in `request_routing_rule`.  The `url_path_map` block supports fields documented below.
    url_path_map = ""

    # authentication_certificate - (Optional) List of authentication certificates.  The `authentication_certificate` block supports fields documented below.
    authentication_certificate = ""

    # ssl_certificate - (Optional) List of ssl certificates. The `ssl_certificate` block supports fields documented below.
    ssl_certificate = ""

    # waf_configuration - (Optional) Web Application Firewall configuration settings. The `waf_configuration` block supports fields documented below.
    waf_configuration = ""

    # disabled_ssl_protocols - (Optional) based on "sslPolicy": {"disabledSslProtocols": []}
    disabled_ssl_protocols = ""

    # subnet_id - (Optional) Reference to a Subnet.
    subnet_id = ""

    # private_ip_address - (Optional) Private IP Address.
    private_ip_address = ""

    # public_ip_address_id - (Optional) Specifies resource Id of a Public Ip Address resource. IPAllocationMethod should be Dynamic.
    public_ip_address_id = ""

    # private_ip_address_allocation - (Optional) Valid values are: `Dynamic`
    private_ip_address_allocation = ""

    # private_ip_address_allocation - (Optional) Valid values are: `Dynamic`
    private_ip_address_allocation = ""

    # private_ip_address_allocation - (Optional) Valid values are: `Dynamic`
    private_ip_address_allocation = ""

    # ip_address_list - (Optional) List of public IPAdresses, or internal IP addresses in a backend address pool.
    ip_address_list = ""

    # fqdn_list - (Optional) List of FQDNs in a backend address pool.
    fqdn_list = ""

    # probe_name - (Optional) Reference to URL probe.
    probe_name = ""

    # authentication_certificate - (Optional) this doesn't seem to belong here
    authentication_certificate = ""

    # host_name - (Optional) HostName for `http_listener`. It has to be a valid DNS name.
    host_name = ""

    # ssl_certificate_name - (Optional) Reference to ssl certificate. Valid only if protocol is https.
    ssl_certificate_name = ""

    # require_sni - (Optional) Applicable only if protocol is https. Enables SNI for multi-hosting. Valid values are:
    require_sni = ""

    # require_sni - (Optional) Applicable only if protocol is https. Enables SNI for multi-hosting. Valid values are:
    require_sni = ""

    # require_sni - (Optional) Applicable only if protocol is https. Enables SNI for multi-hosting. Valid values are:
    require_sni = ""

    # backend_address_pool_name - (Optional) Reference to `backend_address_pool_name`. Valid for Basic Rule only.
    backend_address_pool_name = ""

    # backend_http_settings_name - (Optional) Reference to `backend_http_settings`. Valid for Basic Rule only.
    backend_http_settings_name = ""

    # url_path_map_name - (Optional) Reference to `url_path_map`. Valid for PathBasedRouting Rule only.
    url_path_map_name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The application gatewayConfiguration ID.
    # "name" - The name of the application gateway.
    # "resource_group_name" - The name of the resource group in which to create the application gateway.
    # "location" - The location/region where the application gateway is created
}
azurerm-resource-application-gateway.description: Creates a new application gateway based on a previously created virtual network with configured subnets.

    name = ""

    origin_host_header = ""

    # is_http_allowed - (Optional) Defaults to `true`.
    is_http_allowed = ""

    # is_https_allowed - (Optional) Defaults to `true`.
    is_https_allowed = ""

    # origin - (Optional) The set of origins of the CDN endpoint. When multiple origins exist, the first origin will be used as primary and rest will be used as failover options. Each `origin` block supports fields documented below.
    origin = ""

    # origin_path - (Optional) The path used at for origin requests.
    origin_path = ""

    # querystring_caching_behaviour - (Optional) Sets query string caching behavior. Allowed values are `IgnoreQueryString`, `BypassCaching` and `UseQueryString`. Defaults to `IgnoreQueryString`.
    querystring_caching_behaviour = ""

    # content_types_to_compress - (Optional) An array of strings that indicates a content types on which compression will be applied. The value for the elements should be MIME types.
    content_types_to_compress = ""

    # is_compression_enabled - (Optional) Indicates whether compression is to be enabled. Defaults to false.
    is_compression_enabled = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # http_port - (Optional) The HTTP port of the origin. Defaults to `80`.
    http_port = ""

    # https_port - (Optional) The HTTPS port of the origin. Defaults to `443`.
    https_port = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The CDN Endpoint ID.
    # "https_port" - (Optional) The HTTPS port of the origin. Defaults to "443".
}
azurerm-resource-cdn-endpoint.description: A CDN Endpoint is the entity within a CDN Profile containing configuration information regarding caching behaviors and origins. The CDN Endpoint is exposed using the URL format <endpointname>.azureedge.net by default, but custom domains can also be created.

azurerm-resource-compute-virtualmachine-.body:
resource "azure_virtual_machine_extension" "$1" {
    # settings - (Required) The settings passed to the extension, these are   specified as a JSON object in a string.
    settings = ""

    # type_handler_version - (Required) Specifies the version of the extension to   use, available versions can be found using the Azure CLI.
    type_handler_version = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of extension, available types for a publisher can   be found using the Azure CLI.
    type = ""

    # publisher - (Required) The publisher of the extension, available publishers   can be found by using the Azure CLI.
    publisher = ""

    # virtual_machine_name - (Required) The name of the virtual machine. Changing   this forces a new resource to be created.
    virtual_machine_name = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be   created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # location - (Required) The location where the extension is created. Changing   this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the virtual machine extension peering. Changing   this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # auto_upgrade_minor_version - (Optional) Specifies if the platform deploys   the latest minor version update to the `type_handler_version` specified.
    auto_upgrade_minor_version = ""

    # protected_settings - (Optional) The protected_settings passed to the   extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.
    protected_settings = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Virtual Machine Extension ID.
    # "protected_settings" - (Optional) The protected_settings passed to the   extension, like settings, these are specified as a JSON object in a string.
}
azurerm-resource-compute-virtualmachine-.description:
Creates a new Virtual Machine Extension to provide post deployment configuration
and run automated tasks.

azurerm-resource-container-group.body:
resource "azurerm_container_group" "$1" {
    # share_name - (Required) The Azure storage share that is to be mounted as a volume. This must be created on the storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    share_name = ""

    # storage_account_key - (Required) The access key for the Azure Storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    storage_account_key = ""

    # storage_account_name - (Required) The Azure storage account from which the volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    storage_account_name = ""

    # mount_path - (Required) The path on which this volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    mount_path = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the volume mount. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # memory - (Required) The required memory of the containers in GB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    memory = ""

    # cpu - (Required) The required number of CPU cores of the containers. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    cpu = ""

    # image - (Required) The container image name. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    image = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # container - (Required) The definition of a container that is part of the group as documented in the `container` block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    container = ""

    # os_type - (Required) The OS for the container group. Allowed values are `Linux` and `Windows`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    os_type = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # ip_address_type - (Optional) Specifies the ip address type of the container. `Public` is the only acceptable value at this time. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    ip_address_type = ""

    # port - (Optional) A public port for the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    port = ""

    # environment_variables - (Optional) A list of environment variables to be set on the container. Specified as a map of name/value pairs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    environment_variables = ""

    # command - (Optional) A command line to be run on the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    command = ""

    # volume - (Optional) The definition of a volume mount for this container as documented in the `volume` block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    volume = ""

    # read_only - (Optional) Specify if the volume is to be mounted as read only or not. The default value is `false`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    read_only = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The container group ID.
    # "ip_address" - The IP address allocated to the container group.
}
azurerm-resource-container-group.description: Create as an Azure Container Group instance.

    storage_account_id = ""

    # sku - (Optional) The SKU name of the the container registry. Possible values are `Classic` (which was previously `Basic`), `Basic`, `Standard` and `Premium`.
    sku = ""

    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Container Registry ID.

    # "admin_password" - The Password associated with the Container Registry Admin account - if the admin account is enabled.
}

azurerm-resource-cosmosdb-account.body:
resource "azurerm_cosmosdb_account" "$1" {
    # priority - (Required) The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.
    priority = ""

    # location - (Required) The name of the Azure region to host replicated data.
    location = ""

    # consistency_level - (Required) The Consistency Level to use for this CosmosDB Account - can be either `BoundedStaleness`, `Eventual`, `Session` or `Strong`.
    consistency_level = ""

    # failover_policy - (Required) Specifies a `failover_policy` resource, used to define where data should be replicated.
    failover_policy = ""

    # consistency_policy - (Required) Specifies a `consistency_policy` resource, used to define the consistency policy for this CosmosDB account.
    consistency_policy = ""

    # offer_type - (Required) Specifies the Offer Type to use for this CosmosDB Account - currently this can only be set to `Standard`.
    offer_type = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which the CosmosDB Account is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the CosmosDB Account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # kind - (Optional) Specifies the Kind of CosmosDB to create - possible values are `GlobalDocumentDB` and `MongoDB`. Defaults to `GlobalDocumentDB`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    kind = ""

    # ip_range_filter - (Optional) CosmosDB Firewall Support: This value specifies the set of IP addresses or IP address ranges in CIDR form to be included as the allowed list of client IP's for a given database account. IP addresses/ranges must be comma separated and must not contain any spaces.
    ip_range_filter = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # consistency_policy - (Optional) `consistency_policy` supports the following:
    consistency_policy = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # max_interval_in_seconds - (Optional) When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the time amount of staleness (in seconds) tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 1 - 100. Defaults to `5`. Required when `consistency_level` is set to `BoundedStaleness`.
    max_interval_in_seconds = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # max_staleness - (Optional) When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the number of stale requests tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 1 – 2,147,483,647. Defaults to `100`. Required when `consistency_level` is set to `BoundedStaleness`.
    max_staleness = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # failover_policy - (Optional) `failover_policy` supports the following:
    failover_policy = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The CosmosDB Account ID.
    # "primary_master_key" - The Primary master key for the CosmosDB Account.
    # "secondary_master_key" - The Secondary master key for the CosmosDB Account.
    # "primary_readonly_master_key" - The Primary read-only master Key for the CosmosDB Account.
    # "secondary_readonly_master_key" - The Secondary read-only master key for the CosmosDB Account.
}
azurerm-resource-cosmosdb-account.description: Creates a new CosmosDB (formally DocumentDB) Account.

    # server_name - (Required) Specifies the name of the MySQL Server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the MySQL Database, which needs [to be a valid MySQL identifier](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/identifiers.html). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the MySQL Database.
    # "collation" - (Required) Specifies the Collation for the MySQL Database, which needs [to be a valid MySQL Collation](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/charset-mysql.html). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
}

azurerm-resource-database-sql-database.body:
resource "azurerm_sql_database" "$1" {
    # server_name - (Required) The name of the SQL Server on which to create the database.
    server_name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the database.  This must be the same as Database Server resource group currently.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the database.
    name = ""

    # create_mode - (Optional) Specifies the type of database to create. Defaults to `Default`. See below for the accepted values/
    create_mode = ""

    # source_database_id - (Optional) The URI of the source database if `create_mode` value is not `Default`.
    source_database_id = ""

    # restore_point_in_time - (Optional) The point in time for the restore. Only applies if `create_mode` is `PointInTimeRestore` e.g. 2013-11-08T22:00:40Z
    restore_point_in_time = ""

    # edition - (Optional) The edition of the database to be created. Applies only if `create_mode` is `Default`. Valid values are: `Basic`, `Standard`, `Premium`, or `DataWarehouse`. Please see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/documentation/articles/sql-database-service-tiers/).
    edition = ""

    # collation - (Optional) The name of the collation. Applies only if `create_mode` is `Default`.  Azure default is `SQL_LATIN1_GENERAL_CP1_CI_AS`
    collation = ""

    # max_size_bytes - (Optional) The maximum size that the database can grow to. Applies only if `create_mode` is `Default`.  Please see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/documentation/articles/sql-database-service-tiers/).
    max_size_bytes = ""

    # requested_service_objective_id - (Optional) Use `requested_service_objective_id` or `requested_service_objective_name` to set the performance level for the database. Valid values are: `S0`, `S1`, `S2`, `S3`, `P1`, `P2`, `P4`, `P6`, `P11` and `ElasticPool`.  Please see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/documentation/articles/sql-database-service-tiers/).
    requested_service_objective_id = ""

    # requested_service_objective_name - (Optional) Use `requested_service_objective_name` or `requested_service_objective_id` to set the performance level for the database.  Please see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/documentation/articles/sql-database-service-tiers/).
    requested_service_objective_name = ""

    # source_database_deletion_date - (Optional) The deletion date time of the source database. Only applies to deleted databases where `create_mode` is `PointInTimeRestore`.
    source_database_deletion_date = ""

    # elastic_pool_name - (Optional) The name of the elastic database pool.
    elastic_pool_name = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The SQL Database ID.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    # "creation_data" - The creation date of the SQL Database.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    # "default_secondary_location" - The default secondary location of the SQL Database.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
}
azurerm-resource-database-sql-database.description: Allows you to manage an Azure SQL Database

azurerm-resource-database-sql-elasticpoo.body:
resource "azurerm_sql_elasticpool" "$1" {
    # dtu - (Required) The total shared DTU for the elastic pool. Valid values depend on the `edition` which has been defined. Refer to [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/azure/sql-database/sql-database-service-tiers#elastic-pool-service-tiers-and-performance-in-edtus) for valid combinations.
    dtu = ""

    # edition - (Required) The edition of the elastic pool to be created. Valid values are `Basic`, `Standard`, and `Premium`. Refer to [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/azure/sql-database/sql-database-service-tiers#elastic-pool-service-tiers-and-performance-in-edtus) for details. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    edition = ""

    # server_name - (Required) The name of the SQL Server on which to create the elastic pool. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    server_name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the elastic pool. This must be the same as the resource group of the underlying SQL server.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the elastic pool. This needs to be globally unique. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # db_dtu_min - (Optional) The minimum DTU which will be guaranteed to all databases in the elastic pool to be created.
    db_dtu_min = ""

    # db_dtu_max - (Optional) The maximum DTU which will be guaranteed to all databases in the elastic pool to be created.
    db_dtu_max = ""

    # pool_size - (Optional) The maximum size in MB that all databases in the elastic pool can grow to. The maximum size must be consistent with combination of `edition` and `dtu` and the limits documented in [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/azure/sql-database/sql-database-service-tiers#elastic-pool-service-tiers-and-performance-in-edtus). If not defined when creating an elastic pool, the value is set to the size implied by `edition` and `dtu`.
    pool_size = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The SQL Elastic Pool ID.
    # "creation_date" - The creation date of the SQL Elastic Pool.
}
azurerm-resource-database-sql-elasticpoo.description: Allows you to manage an Azure SQL Elastic Pool.

    name = ""

    # listen - (Optional) Does this Authorization Rule have permissions to Listen to the Event Hub? Defaults to `false`.
    listen = ""

    # send - (Optional) Does this Authorization Rule have permissions to Send to the Event Hub? Defaults to `false`.
    send = ""

    # manage - (Optional) Does this Authorization Rule have permissions to Manage to the Event Hub? When this property is `true` - both `listen` and `send` must be too. Defaults to `false`.

azurerm-resource-key-vault-x.body:
resource "azurerm_key_vault" "$1" {
    # secret_permissions - (Required) List of secret permissions, must be one or more   from the following: `backup`, `delete`, `get`, `list`, `purge`, `recover`, `restore` and `set`.
    secret_permissions = ""

    # key_permissions - (Required) List of key permissions, must be one or more from   the following: `backup`, `create`, `decrypt`, `delete`, `encrypt`, `get`, `import`, `list`, `purge`, `recover`, `restore`, `sign`, `unwrapKey`, `update`, `verify` and `wrapKey`.
    key_permissions = ""

    # object_id - (Required) The object ID of a user, service principal or security   group in the Azure Active Directory tenant for the vault. The object ID must   be unique for the list of access policies.
    object_id = ""

    # tenant_id - (Required) The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used   for authenticating requests to the key vault. Must match the `tenant_id` used   above.
    tenant_id = ""

    # name - (Required) SKU name to specify whether the key vault is a `standard`
    name = ""

    # access_policy - (Required) An access policy block as described below. At least   one policy is required up to a maximum of 16.
    access_policy = ""

    # tenant_id - (Required) The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be   used for authenticating requests to the key vault.
    tenant_id = ""

    # sku - (Required) An SKU block as described below.
    sku = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists.   Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the Key Vault resource. Changing this   forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # enabled_for_deployment - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether Azure Virtual   Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key   vault. Defaults to false.
    enabled_for_deployment = ""

    # enabled_for_disk_encryption - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether Azure   Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.   Defaults to false.
    enabled_for_disk_encryption = ""

    # enabled_for_template_deployment - (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether   Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault.   Defaults to false.
    enabled_for_template_deployment = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # sku - (Optional) `sku` supports the following:
    sku = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # access_policy - (Optional) `access_policy` supports the following:
    access_policy = ""

    # application_id - (Optional) The object ID of an Application in Azure Active Directory.
    application_id = ""

    # certificate_permissions - (Optional) List of certificate permissions, must be one or more from   the following: `create`, `delete`, `deleteissuers`, `get`, `getissuers`, `import`, `list`, `listissuers`, `managecontacts`, `manageissuers`, `purge`, `recover`, `setissuers` and `update`.
    certificate_permissions = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Vault ID.
    # "secret_permissions" - (Required) List of secret permissions, must be one or more   from the following: "backup", "delete", "get", "list", "purge", "recover", "restore" and "set".
    # "vault_uri" - The URI of the vault for performing operations on keys and secrets.
    # "secret_permissions" - (Required) List of secret permissions, must be one or more   from the following: "backup", "delete", "get", "list", "purge", "recover", "restore" and "set".
}

    # protocol - (Required) The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are `Udp` or `Tcp`.

    name = ""

    # protocol - (Optional) Specifies the protocol of the end point. Possible values are `Http` or `Tcp`. If Tcp is specified, a received ACK is required for the probe to be successful. If Http is specified, a 200 OK response from the specified URI is required for the probe to be successful.
    protocol = ""

    # request_path - (Optional) The URI used for requesting health status from the backend endpoint. Required if protocol is set to Http. Otherwise, it is not allowed.
    request_path = ""

    # interval_in_seconds - (Optional) The interval, in seconds between probes to the backend endpoint for health status. The default value is 15, the minimum value is 5.
    interval_in_seconds = ""

    # number_of_probes - (Optional) The number of failed probe attempts after which the backend endpoint is removed from rotation. The default value is 2. NumberOfProbes multiplied by intervalInSeconds value must be greater or equal to 10.Endpoints are returned to rotation when at least one probe is successful.

    service_provider_name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists.   Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the ExpressRoute circuit. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # allow_classic_operations - (Optional) Allow the circuit to interact with classic (RDFE) resources.   The default value is false.
    allow_classic_operations = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # sku - (Optional) `sku` supports the following:
    sku = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Resource ID of the ExpressRoute circuit.
    # "family" - (Required) The billing mode. Value must be either "MeteredData" or "UnlimitedData".  Once you set the billing model to "UnlimitedData", you will not be able to switch to "MeteredData".
    # "service_provider_provisioning_state" - The ExpressRoute circuit provisioning state from your chosen service provider.
    # "family" - (Required) The billing mode. Value must be either "MeteredData" or "UnlimitedData".  Once you set the billing model to "UnlimitedData", you will not be able to switch to "MeteredData".

    # "family" - (Required) The billing mode. Value must be either "MeteredData" or "UnlimitedData".  Once you set the billing model to "UnlimitedData", you will not be able to switch to "MeteredData".
}

resource "azure_network_interface" "$1" {
    # private_ip_address_allocation - (Required) Defines how a private IP address is assigned. Options are Static or Dynamic.

    # subnet_id - (Required) Reference to a subnet in which this NIC has been created.
    subnet_id = ""

    # name - (Required) User-defined name of the IP.
    name = ""

    # ip_configuration - (Required) One or more `ip_configuration` associated with this NIC as documented below.
    ip_configuration = ""

    # location - (Required) The location/region where the network interface is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the network interface. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the network interface. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # network_security_group_id - (Optional) The ID of the Network Security Group to associate with the network interface.
    network_security_group_id = ""

    # internal_dns_name_label - (Optional) Relative DNS name for this NIC used for internal communications between VMs in the same VNet
    internal_dns_name_label = ""

    # enable_ip_forwarding - (Optional) Enables IP Forwarding on the NIC. Defaults to `false`.
    enable_ip_forwarding = ""

    # dns_servers - (Optional) List of DNS servers IP addresses to use for this NIC, overrides the VNet-level server list
    dns_servers = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # private_ip_address - (Optional) Static IP Address.
    private_ip_address = ""

    # public_ip_address_id - (Optional) Reference to a Public IP Address to associate with this NIC
    public_ip_address_id = ""

    # load_balancer_backend_address_pools_ids - (Optional) List of Load Balancer Backend Address Pool IDs references to which this NIC belongs
    load_balancer_backend_address_pools_ids = ""

    # load_balancer_inbound_nat_rules_ids - (Optional) List of Load Balancer Inbound Nat Rules IDs involving this NIC
    load_balancer_inbound_nat_rules_ids = ""

    # primary - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to `true` this should be the first `ip_configuration` in the array.
    primary = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Virtual Network Interface ID.
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
    # "mac_address" - The media access control (MAC) address of the network interface.
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
    # "private_ip_address" - The private ip address of the network interface.
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
    # "virtual_machine_id" - Reference to a VM with which this NIC has been associated.
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
    # "applied_dns_servers" - If the VM that uses this NIC is part of an Availability Set, then this list will have the union of all DNS servers from all NICs that are part of the Availability Set
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
    # "internal_fqdn" - Fully qualified DNS name supporting internal communications between VMs in the same VNet
    # "primary" - (Optional) Is this the Primary Network Interface? If set to "true" this should be the first "ip_configuration" in the array.
}
azurerm-resource-network-interface.description: Manages a Network Interface located in a Virtual Network, usually attached to a Virtual Machine.

azurerm-resource-network-security-group.body:
resource "azurerm_network_security_group" "$1" {
    # direction - (Required) The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic. Possible values are `Inbound` and `Outbound`.
    direction = ""

    priority = ""

    # access - (Required) Specifies whether network traffic is allowed or denied. Possible values are `Allow` and `Deny`.
    access = ""

    # destination_address_prefix - (Required) CIDR or destination IP range or * to match any IP. Tags such as `VirtualNetwork`, `AzureLoadBalancer` and `Internet` can also be used.
    destination_address_prefix = ""

    # source_address_prefix - (Required) CIDR or source IP range or * to match any IP. Tags such as `VirtualNetwork`, `AzureLoadBalancer` and `Internet` can also be used.
    source_address_prefix = ""

    # destination_port_range - (Required) Destination Port or Range. Integer or range between `0` and `65535` or `*` to match any.
    destination_port_range = ""

    # source_port_range - (Required) Source Port or Range. Integer or range between `0` and `65535` or `*` to match any.
    source_port_range = ""

    # protocol - (Required) Network protocol this rule applies to. Can be `Tcp`, `Udp` or `*` to match both.
    protocol = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the security rule.
    name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the availability set. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the network security group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # security_rule - (Optional) One or more `security_rule` blocks as defined below.
    security_rule = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 characters.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Network Security Group ID.
    # "direction" - (Required) The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic. Possible values are "Inbound" and "Outbound".
}
azurerm-resource-network-security-group.description:
Manages a network security group that contains a list of network security rules.  Network security groups enable inbound or outbound traffic to be enabled or denied. ~> **NOTE on Network Security Groups and Network Security Rules:** Terraform currently
provides both a standalone [Network Security Rule resource](network_security_rule.html), and allows for Network Security Rules to be defined in-line within the [Network Security Group resource](network_security_group.html).
At this time you cannot use a Network Security Group with in-line Network Security Rules in conjunction with any Network Security Rule resources. Doing so will cause a conflict of rule settings and will overwrite rules.

    protocol = ""

azurerm-resource-network-subnet.description:
Manages a subnet. Subnets represent network segments within the IP space defined by the virtual network. ~> **NOTE on Virtual Networks and Subnet's:** Terraform currently
provides both a standalone [Subnet resource](subnet.html), and allows for Subnets to be defined in-line within the [Virtual Network resource](virtual_network.html).

    endpoint_status = ""

    # target - (Optional) The FQDN DNS name of the target. This argument must be   provided for an endpoint of type `externalEndpoints`, for other types it   will be computed.
    target = ""

    # target_resource_id - (Optional) The resource id of an Azure resource to   target. This argument must be provided for an endpoint of type   `azureEndpoints` or `nestedEndpoints`.
    target_resource_id = ""

    # weight - (Optional) Specifies how much traffic should be distributed to this   endpoint, this must be specified for Profiles using the  `Weighted` traffic   routing method. Supports values between 1 and 1000.
    weight = ""

    # priority - (Optional) Specifies the priority of this Endpoint, this must be   specified for Profiles using the `Priority` traffic routing method. Supports   values between 1 and 1000, with no Endpoints sharing the same value. If   omitted the value will be computed in order of creation.
    priority = ""

    # endpoint_location - (Optional) Specifies the Azure location of the Endpoint,   this must be specified for Profiles using the `Performance` routing method   if the Endpoint is of either type `nestedEndpoints` or `externalEndpoints`.   For Endpoints of type `azureEndpoints` the value will be taken from the   location of the Azure target resource.
    endpoint_location = ""

    # min_child_endpoints - (Optional) This argument specifies the minimum number   of endpoints that must be ‘online’ in the child profile in order for the   parent profile to direct traffic to any of the endpoints in that child   profile. This argument only applies to Endpoints of type `nestedEndpoints`   and defaults to `1`.
    min_child_endpoints = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Traffic Manager Endpoint id.
    # "min_child_endpoints" - (Optional) This argument specifies the minimum number   of endpoints that must be ‘online’ in the child profile in order for the   parent profile to direct traffic to any of the endpoints in that child   profile. This argument only applies to Endpoints of type "nestedEndpoints"   and defaults to "1".
}

azurerm-resource-network-virtual-network.body:
resource "azure_virtual_network" "$1" {

    address_prefix = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the subnet.
    name = ""

    # location - (Required) The location/region where the virtual network is   created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # address_space - (Required) The address space that is used the virtual   network. You can supply more than one address space. Changing this forces   a new resource to be created.
    address_space = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the virtual network.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # dns_servers - (Optional) List of IP addresses of DNS servers
    dns_servers = ""

    # subnet - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times to define multiple   subnets. Each `subnet` block supports fields documented below.
    subnet = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # security_group - (Optional) The Network Security Group to associate with   the subnet. (Referenced by `id`, ie. `azurerm_network_security_group.test.id`)
    security_group = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The virtual NetworkConfiguration ID.
    # "name" - The name of the virtual network.
    # "resource_group_name" - The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual network.
    # "location" - The location/region where the virtual network is created
    # "address_space" - The address space that is used the virtual network.

azurerm-resource-network-virtual-network.description:
Creates a new virtual network including any configured subnets. Each subnet can
optionally be configured with a security group to be associated with the subnet. ~> **NOTE on Virtual Networks and Subnet's:** Terraform currently
provides both a standalone [Subnet resource](subnet.html), and allows for Subnets to be defined in-line within the [Virtual Network resource](virtual_network.html).
At this time you cannot use a Virtual Network with in-line Subnets in conjunction with any Subnet resources. Doing so will cause a conflict of Subnet configurations and will overwrite Subnet's.

azurerm-resource-network-virtual-network.body:
resource "azure_virtual_network_peering" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be   created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # remote_virtual_network_id - (Required) The full Azure resource ID of the   remote virtual network.  Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    remote_virtual_network_id = ""

    # virtual_network_name - (Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing   this forces a new resource to be created.
    virtual_network_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the virtual network peering. Changing this   forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # allow_virtual_network_access - (Optional) Controls if the VMs in the remote   virtual network can access VMs in the local virtual network. Defaults to   false.
    allow_virtual_network_access = ""

    # allow_forwarded_traffic - (Optional) Controls if forwarded traffic from  VMs   in the remote virtual network is allowed. Defaults to false.
    allow_forwarded_traffic = ""

    # allow_gateway_transit - (Optional) Controls gatewayLinks can be used in the   remote virtual network’s link to the local virtual network.
    allow_gateway_transit = ""

    # use_remote_gateways - (Optional) Controls if remote gateways can be used on   the local virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and   allowGatewayTransit on the remote peering is also true, virtual network will   use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can   have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network   already has a gateway. Defaults to false.
    use_remote_gateways = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Virtual Network Peering resource ID.
    # "use_remote_gateways" - (Optional) Controls if remote gateways can be used on   the local virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and   allowGatewayTransit on the remote peering is also true, virtual network will   use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can   have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network   already has a gateway. Defaults to false.
}
azurerm-resource-network-virtual-network.description:
Creates a new virtual network peering which allows resources to access other
resources in the linked virtual network.

azurerm-resource-redis-cache.body:
resource "azurerm_redis_cache" "$1" {
    # redis_configuration - (Required) A `redis_configuration` as defined below - with some limitations by SKU - defaults/details are shown below.
    redis_configuration = ""

    # sku_name - (Required) The SKU of Redis to use - can be either Basic, Standard or Premium.
    sku_name = ""

    # family - (Required) The SKU family to use. Valid values are `C` and `P`, where C = Basic/Standard, P = Premium.
    family = ""

    # capacity - (Required) The size of the Redis cache to deploy. Valid values for a SKU `family` of C (Basic/Standard) are `0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6`, and for P (Premium) `family` are `1, 2, 3, 4`.
    capacity = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the Redis instance.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # location - (Required) The location of the resource group.
    location = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Redis instance. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # enable_non_ssl_port - (Optional) Enable the non-SSL port (6789) - disabled by default.
    enable_non_ssl_port = ""

    # shard_count - (Optional) *Only available when using the Premium SKU* The number of Shards to create on the Redis Cluster.
    shard_count = ""

    # patch_schedule - (Optional) A list of `patch_schedule` blocks as defined below - only available for Premium SKU's.
    patch_schedule = ""

    # redis_configuration - (Optional) `redis_configuration` supports the following:
    redis_configuration = ""

    # maxclients - (Optional) Set the max number of connected clients at the same time. Defaults are shown below.
    maxclients = ""

    # maxmemory_reserve - (Optional) Value in megabytes reserved for non-cache usage e.g. failover. Defaults are shown below.
    maxmemory_reserve = ""

    # maxclients - (Optional) Set the max number of connected clients at the same time. Defaults are shown below.
    maxclients = ""

    # maxmemory_delta - (Optional) The max-memory delta for this Redis instance. Defaults are shown below.
    maxmemory_delta = ""

    # maxclients - (Optional) Set the max number of connected clients at the same time. Defaults are shown below.
    maxclients = ""

    # maxmemory_policy - (Optional) How Redis will select what to remove when `maxmemory` is reached. Defaults are shown below.
    maxmemory_policy = ""

    # rdb_backup_enabled - (Optional) Is Backup Enabled? Only supported on Premium SKU's.
    rdb_backup_enabled = ""

    # rdb_backup_frequency - (Optional) The Backup Frequency in Minutes. Only supported on Premium SKU's. Possible values are: `15`, `30`, `60`, `360`, `720` and `1440`.
    rdb_backup_frequency = ""

    # rdb_backup_enabled - (Optional) Is Backup Enabled? Only supported on Premium SKU's.
    rdb_backup_enabled = ""

    # rdb_backup_max_snapshot_count - (Optional) The maximum number of snapshots to create as a backup. Only supported for Premium SKU's.
    rdb_backup_max_snapshot_count = ""

    # rdb_backup_enabled - (Optional) Is Backup Enabled? Only supported on Premium SKU's.
    rdb_backup_enabled = ""

    # rdb_storage_connection_string - (Optional) The Connection String to the Storage Account. Only supported for Premium SKU's. In the format: `DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;BlobEndpoint=${azurerm_storage_account.test.primary_blob_endpoint};AccountName=${azurerm_storage_account.test.name};AccountKey=${azurerm_storage_account.test.primary_access_key}`.
    rdb_storage_connection_string = ""

    # rdb_backup_enabled - (Optional) Is Backup Enabled? Only supported on Premium SKU's.
    rdb_backup_enabled = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Route ID.
    # "hostname" - The Hostname of the Redis Instance
    # "ssl_port" - The SSL Port of the Redis Instance
    # "port" - The non-SSL Port of the Redis Instance
    # "primary_access_key" - The Primary Access Key for the Redis Instance
    # "secondary_access_key" - The Secondary Access Key for the Redis Instance
}
azurerm-resource-redis-cache.description: Creates a new Redis Cache Resource

resource "azurerm_servicebus_queue" "$1" {
    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # location - (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists.   Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    location = ""

    # namespace_name - (Required) The name of the ServiceBus Namespace to create   this queue in. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    namespace_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the name of the ServiceBus Queue resource. Changing this forces a   new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # auto_delete_on_idle - (Optional) The idle interval after which the   Queue is automatically deleted, minimum of 5 minutes. Provided in the [TimeSpan](#timespan-format)   format.
    auto_delete_on_idle = ""

    # default_message_ttl - (Optional) The TTL of messages sent to this queue. This is the default value   used when TTL is not set on message itself. Provided in the [TimeSpan](#timespan-format)   format.
    default_message_ttl = ""

    # duplicate_detection_history_time_window - (Optional) The duration during which   duplicates can be detected. Default value is 10 minutes. Provided in the [TimeSpan](#timespan-format) format.
    duplicate_detection_history_time_window = ""

    # enable_express - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether Express Entities   are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing   it to persistent storage. Defaults to `false` for Basic and Standard. For Premium, it MUST   be set to `false`.
    enable_express = ""

    # enable_partitioning - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether to enable
    enable_partitioning = ""

    # enable_express - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether Express Entities   are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing   it to persistent storage. Defaults to `false` for Basic and Standard. For Premium, it MUST   be set to `false`.
    enable_express = ""

    # max_size_in_megabytes - (Optional) Integer value which controls the size of   memory allocated for the queue. For supported values see the "Queue/topic size"   section of [this document](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/service-bus-messaging/service-bus-quotas).
    max_size_in_megabytes = ""

    # requires_duplicate_detection - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether   the Queue requires duplicate detection. Changing this forces   a new resource to be created. Defaults to `false`.
    requires_duplicate_detection = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ServiceBus Queue ID.
    # "requires_duplicate_detection" - (Optional) Boolean flag which controls whether   the Queue requires duplicate detection. Changing this forces   a new resource to be created. Defaults to "false".
}

    account_encryption_source = ""

    # custom_domain - (Optional) A `custom_domain` block as documented below.

azurerm-resource-storage-blob.body:
resource "azurerm_storage_blob" "$1" {
    # storage_container_name - (Required) The name of the storage container in which this blob should be created.
    storage_container_name = ""

    # storage_account_name - (Required) Specifies the storage account in which to create the storage container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    storage_account_name = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the resource group in which to   create the storage container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the storage blob. Must be unique within the storage container the blob is located.
    name = ""

    # type - (Optional) The type of the storage blob to be created. One of either `block` or `page`. When not copying from an existing blob,   this becomes required.
    type = ""

    # size - (Optional) Used only for `page` blobs to specify the size in bytes of the blob to be created. Must be a multiple of 512. Defaults to 0.
    size = ""

    # source - (Optional) An absolute path to a file on the local system. Cannot be defined if `source_uri` is defined.
    source = ""

    # source_uri - (Optional) The URI of an existing blob, or a file in the Azure File service, to use as the source contents   for the blob to be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Cannot be defined if `source` is defined.
    source_uri = ""

    # parallelism - (Optional) The number of workers per CPU core to run for concurrent uploads. Defaults to `8`.
    parallelism = ""

    # attempts - (Optional) The number of attempts to make per page or block when uploading. Defaults to `1`.
    attempts = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The storage blob Resource ID.
    # "attempts" - (Optional) The number of attempts to make per page or block when uploading. Defaults to "1".
    # "url" - The URL of the blob
    # "attempts" - (Optional) The number of attempts to make per page or block when uploading. Defaults to "1".
}

}

    deployment_mode = ""

    resource_group_name = ""

    name = ""

    template_body = ""

    parameters = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The Template Deployment ID.

azurerm-resource-template-deployment.description:
Create a template deployment of resources ~> **Note on ARM Template Deployments:** Due to the way the underlying Azure API is designed, Terraform can only manage the deployment of the ARM Template - and not any resources which are created by it.
This means that when deleting the `azurerm_template_deployment` resource, Terraform will only remove the reference to the deployment, whilst leaving any resources created by that ARM Template Deployment.
One workaround for this is to use a unique Resource Group for each ARM Template Deployment, which means deleting the Resource Group would contain any resources created within it - however this isn't ideal. [More information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/resources/deployments#Deployments_Delete).
